intro: Eupatorium donnell-smithii var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved boneset, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
